Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai iced green tea
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Fried Rice

4Uvi1MmdVlGTsX3MZ56c2w.text: Great little Thai place in Shadyside. The food is fresh and service is good. It gets busy so better to have a reso. I've also done home delivery via yelp and that was really good too though tad pricey for lunch. Was a lot of food and very flavorful.

boRhqiO-my5JhT4HzfEDMQ.text: My friends and I walked here--with bottles of wine in tow--because we didn't want to wait over an hour to be seated at Noodlehead.   We also chose Senyai because we were in the mood for Asian cuisine, and because it was BYOB. As a result of our changing plans, we had not made a reservation. Senyai is a smaller restaurant and it was a Friday night, so we weren't surprised when the hostess told us we had to wait for a party to finish their meal before we could take their table. However, the wait staff actually shoehorned a table into a little nook between the kitchen and dining room for us so that we could be seated sooner.  This gesture and service helped make my experience at Senyai an excellent one. Sure, the space we were in was cramped. In order to leave my seat I had to push the entire table away from me. Both spent and chilling wine bottles had to be put on the floor. The kitchen staff probably heard most of our conversations. But, it felt like an intimate/private dining experience with my friends, and we were extremely appreciative to be seated nearly immediately.   The service for the rest of the meal was excellent, too--unfortunately I do not remember my waitress' name. The food was delicious, as well. I ordered the panang curry with pork, and got it at a 3/3 on the spicy scale, which was very spicy, but not overwhelmingly so.  If I had a complaint, it's that relative to the prices, the serving sizes are on the smaller size. With tip and a $5 corkage fee, two entrees cost $43.  Overall, I had a great meal and experience at Senyai and would definitely dine there again.

RnLyOQgZosR_UuIFgPpoFw.text: Senyai has become our go-to place for Thai food in Pittsburgh, even though we have to drive a good bit for it!  The interior is clean and well-lit, and the staff is always working to make us comfortable whenever we visit.  Don't be put off by the lack of parking on Ellsworth--head around back to park in the Senyai lot!    The food is good, and many dishes can be made completely without spicy heat, a fact that my girlfriend appreciates.  The Kee Mao noodles were quite tasty, and anything with duck has proven to be delicious.  We will keep coming back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ba-Mee Ped.  The duck was delicious!
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kee Mao Noodles.  Tasty!

IOQqxFyIHnM8jkr6AnRWMg.text: Great food. The food was prepared well not over or under cooked and perfect amount of flavoring, not overly done. Ingredients taste fresh. The only reason why it's not a 5 star is the waiters hair was not pulled back (it was long) and hung over the food at times and he also spoke over the food instead of keeping his head/mouth away from it.

QIQVi7d4Ldujhnx7hQPtkw.text: The food is very fresh and spicy if you order a 3! Overall I loved all of the food. Some of the best Thai food around Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Fried rice

vwxYsiARR6Fu1vmMDDWsFw.text: The red and green vegetable curry, the chicken kee mao noodles, and crab ragoons are all fantastic! I am a big fan of this place and will keep going back!

X_c6KRWAXDI6CwLuk2j6Og.text: Awesome little spot in an out of the way location. Set in what used to be a house, this place has a lovely half intimate half homey atmosphere. The servers were very prompt and professional and the food was delicious. I had the Tom Yum soup (appetizer size) and the Pad Thai, and my friend got the full entree size Tom Yum. The flavors of both Tom Yums were excellent, and the appetizer size Tom Yum had quite a kick (a level 2 on their 1-3 spice scale) but I preferred the flavors of the full size Tom Yum which had shrimp and an excellent lemon seafood flavor. The Pad Thai was very well done and the portion size was very large for the price, which I liked. Definitely the best Tom Yum I have had in Pittsburgh, and one of the better Pad Thais. The only complaint I could find would be that the music was quite loud and they had the same song on repeat for 45 minutes, not a big deal but slightly irritating.

XNSuOdZf38klaCiYT7sszA.text: We decided to try this place because of the reviews. We thought this place was cute. What we ordered: a Tom Kha, Lemongrass Salad, and Red Curry. What they brought out for soup: a Tom Yum, and then when we said we ordered a Tom Kha the waitress wanted to tell us we were wrong so we just ordered another Tom Kha. What we thought of the food:  Tom Kha - Good flavor, but had cabbage in it, which was a little different than an authentic Tom Kha.  Tom Yum - Had good flavor as well.  Lemongrass Salad - Wasn't worth it. There wasn't much going on. I would pass on this one. Red Curry - Needed more curry flavor. Just tasted like coconut. I would pass on this too.  We had to pay for the extra Tom Kha. Anyway, seems like the only thing we enjoyed here was the Tom Kha and the Tom Yum. Spicy also isn't very spicy here. I probably won't be back.

RJoDj67UZ1aFmfBkNuTusQ.text: Best Thai food I've had in a while! The flavors are so complex and I looooove that their spicy food is actually very spicy. You can ask for different levels of spice too.  I was just in town for the weekend attending a graduation, but I know if I lived in Pittsburgh I would be a regular here 100%.

KcnsAUnmwMkcZWsYJxir_Q.text: This is probably my favorite Thai Restaurant in Pittsburgh - if not my favorite restaurant ever.  As soon as I walked in I had a feeling that this was going to be an amazing experience - and I was more than pleasantly surprised. Just the smell that permeated the restaurant and the ambiance of the decor make you realize that whoever runs this establishment has good taste, is clean and organized, and gives a lot of attention to detail and the subtle nuances of all the pleasures life has to offer.  One of my closest friends (who is also a really good cook) invited me here out of the blue and introduced this place to me as one of her favorite places. We shared an entree and a couple beverages which I will expound on here :  Green curry - best curry ever, creamy and rich in flavor with well balanced spices and a good variety of vegetables (which they let us pick) cooked to perfection.   Green Thai Tea - this refreshing beverage uses high quality matcha and coconut milk and gives you a clean energy throughout the day.  Blue Lemongrass - this is my friends favorite tea ever and I could see why - it has a very unique flavor and is very comforting.  This restaurant uses high quality, fresh ingredients and offers their meals at VERY reasonable prices - I highly suggest going here and ordering some of the menu. You will NOT be disappointed. I plan to invite my vegan and gluten free friends here also since they have a lot of these options on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sign
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blue Lemongrass Tea
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

LypifBFtQNC1xJJY5-KC7Q.text: This was an awesome find for us, and we are so thankful that we did!  It was some of the best thai food I have had.  And, the service and ambiance was fantastic.  We started with a thai iced tea, and a thai green iced tea.  Both were awesome.  It was my first-find for the green option.  I really liked it!  It had a very unique flavor, and I am glad I ventured off of my normal thai tea choice to try it.   I tried their Tom Kha soup...and it was the best i've ever had.  I've been having dreams about it ever since.  I need to go back!   For dinner, we tried the Pumpkin Curry and the Kee Mao (we chose chicken as the protein).  Both were fantastic.  They had just the right level of heat, and an abundance of flavor.  Delicious!  The only thing I can critique is that in my personal opinion, I would have liked a bit more protein in the curry, and found it just a tad bit small portion-wise for the price compared to the other dinner we received.  This again, though, is my personal opinion.  However, it did have an abundance of delicious chunks of pumpkin in it.  So, maybe that is why it was a little less on the meat?  Either way, though, the flavor was unbelievable!  I would get it over, and over, and over again.    I can't wait to make my way down to that area again to try some of the other things.  I found many visits worth of choices I would like to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin Curry
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kee Mao
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tom Kha Soup

dnmUCUJcY6uWllIan0iWtA.text: Came here for dinner and everything I had here was amazing. The prices were a bit more expensive than your average Thai restaurant but the quality explains it. My only complaint would be that the Seafood Delight appetizer only had two pieces of shrimp which made it difficult for everyone to have a taste.  My family and I ordered the crab fried rice, duck curry and shrimp pad thai. The crab fried rice was my favorite with lots of large crab chunks throughout the dish. The shrimp pad thai was good but nothing surprising and the duck curry was really flavorful.  The service was great but it does get busy so definitely make reservations ahead of time for dinner. Great for a date night or even just dinner with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Fried Rice
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck Curry

7gd3uqlkUPyio5X-i--Oig.text: Beautiful meal at Senyai Thai Kitchen! We sat in their gorgeous patio on one of the nicest days this year. Ordered crispy tofu bites and fresh rolls for our appetizer and shared a Kee Mao Tofu for our main. The fresh rolls were delicious, lots of vermicelli, and I really liked the sauce. The Kee Mao and tofu bites were also delicious but pretty oily. Too much oil on both, it left a residue on my lips. It was a shame because this was one of the most unique and delicious Kee Mao's I've ever had. Many kinds of vegetables when the standard usually just has cabbage or bok choy. It also had an almost grilled, smoked flavor.  I was very happy to see vegan curries and will absolutely come back and try one. Our waiter was more than lovely as well. Overall, very good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Tofu
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kee mao
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh Senyai Summer Roll (2 Pieces)

aEQaMdG9qLzIbW5PJ_6W9A.text: Senyai is an awesome date spot and hits all the boxes. Senyai offers a very large Thai menu that features great appetizers for sharing or keeping to yourself. The entrees are all generous portions and it's byob! The inside seating is intimate and the outdoor deck seating is great as Senyai is conveniently located on Ellsworth Ave.   Crab ragoons and the dumplings are great starters and both come with great sauces for dipping. I've often enjoyed the crab fried rice which provides plenty of lump crab meat. I wanted to try a new noodle dish my last visit and the waitress recommended the si-ew which was a nice change from an always solid pad thai. The noodles and brown sauce were amazing and there was a ton of chicken and vegetables. I ordered a one spice level and additional of the house spice on the side.   I've also ordered from Senyai a number of times for take out as it is a quick walk and the food again is always delicious and holds up through delivery. It's a great place to frequent or go on a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Fried Rice
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3ICvpCb78D1E3J9_2yXUyg.text: Unfortunately I have had two bad meals at Senyai since my original visit. On both cases the noodles (pad thai, kee mao) significantly lacked flavor. Multiple others at my table were also disappointed with their meals. The roasted duck (Ba-Mee Ped) was okay, but not worth the price in my opinion.   The outdoor patio remains a really nice location for a meal, but I can't recommend Senyai for it's food.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ba-Mee Ped (roast duck), 3.5/5 stars, $18

CyHaxlvBtotHtHp8UYdwUA.text: Truly exceptional fresh and beautiful food. The sauce in the stir fry was an accent rather than a distraction. The veggies were fresh and perfectly prepared. I sat outside on the lovely deck. It was perfect. One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever eaten at. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enjoying the Grapow with chicken and brown rice on the sunny deck.

rUyaCtf-dYLmnKwoo0xO2A.text: This is such a great place!  We sat outside for our visit and their patio is just perfect.  We ordered crab Rangoon to start and it was so yummy!  You could tell there was actually real crab in it.  I ordered the pad medmamuag and my boyfriend ordered the hung lay curry.  Both dishes were so good!  I love this place is byob so remember to bring a bottle of wine with you!  Our server was wonderful!  Can't wait to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Rangoon (6 Pieces) so good!

r_39ElZuIkpNB4vlE0adbw.text: The absolute most delicious Thai food I have ever had the chance to taste in my life! There's really no other way to describe the dishes at Senyai. The reputation precedes itself for sure and perfectly displays what it is to have authentic Thai. I was recommended this place by a co-worker and had learned that the co-owner (Gary) was also a co-worker (what a coincidence!) So after reading as well as hearing multiple positive reviews, I decided to make a reservation and head in.  Situated in a quaint and cozy neighborhood, Senyai had a welcoming feel to it. The decor was modern and lively, and the sensual scents of fried rice, noodles and fresh herbs graced my nose as soon as I entered. We were able to snag a seat for two right by the window right before the dinner rush, so reservations are a strong suggestion.   I started with the spring rolls, which tasted as if they were prepared by only a top-skilled chef with crisp carrots, spring mix and cool cucumbers. The peanut dipping sauce was an excellent compliment and the portion size of 8 was more than worth the price. I also recommend the Thai herb wings, absolutely cooked to perfection. I followed with the crab fried rice on a plate that was big enough to feed 3! Huge chunks of hot, steamy crab filled the soft but sticky fried rice. It was absolutely amazing! My fiancee ordered the Si-Ew with chicken and loved every bit of it there and the next day. BYOB was only a few bucks which made our experience even that much more enjoyable.  Senyai definitely lived up to the hype and I reminisce the tastes of it almost everyday. I want to thank Gary, his wife and their team for a superb dining experience. We can't wait to stop back.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jICy3CJ85Ssy-spcw-ZDpw.text: Had the green curry with tofu and my wife had the shrimp pad Thai. Green curry had good depth of flavor and was generous in size. Pad Thai was.....pad Thai good shrimp nice taste not disappointing but not anything more than anyone else's pad Thai. Would order again. Solid Thai food

_ltsxMVnpUm0T243njz99g.text: I was visiting Pitt while moving my cousin into his apartment at CMU and was really determined to find a good place that would suit my family's taste. They're very particular about the food they like and I didn't want to disappoint. Thank you Senyai for being the perfect lunch spot! I loved everything from the Thai Iced Tea and purple lemonade, to the different noodle dishes I had, and even the delicious mango sticky rice for dessert, and so did my family of picky eaters! The service was great and so was the music selection! I asked some of the employees about the artists they played, such as Yaeji, one of my personal favorite artists and they were even well-versed in knowledge about her and local talents. It really made me so happy to have such a great customer service experience and the employees deserve to be recognized for conversing with me and my family so politely and patiently. Overall, this is an excellent spot, not too pricey, and has a very friendly and welcoming staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Iced Tea

UHfWVkAMmyJdFFY7LxORRw.text: 4.5 stars  I was here last Thursday and forgot to review it. The food was excellent! This is a cute well decorated restaurant and feels very new and fresh when you walk in. They also have a patio but it was closed when we went because bad weather was expected. We ordered the summer veggie rolls served with a delicious peanut sauce, my wife had the pumpkin curry dish which she absolutely loved, and I had the pad Thai special with shrimp and chicken. It is BYOB, but being out of towners, We didn't bring anything but the corkage fee is very reasonable: one dollar per beer and five dollars per bottle of wine. The prices for entrees were also fair. The only thing preventing this from review from being a full five stars was that the shrimp was rubbery and overcooked. Otherwise we really enjoyed this place and would definitely come back when passing through Pittsburgh again.

-JPxEhIn88QOR9JxX3aHZQ.text: We stopped here the other night.  This was our second visit, and after recovering from a turkey hangover we were excited to come back.  When we arrived there was a larger table in the front of the place but they soon left and we were alone to enjoy our meals.  For an appetizer we ordered their summer rolls, and asked for a carousel of Thai chili sauce.  We were presented with the sauce and a ground up spice.  I began mixing up my sauce then I dumped a lot too much dry spice on my prepared sauce.  I thought it would be ok so I ate my rolls as normal.  Tasty and fresh, though a tad on the smaller side VS other places.  So after eating we waited to be served our meals.  Here is where the Thai spice lurched with angry might from my mouth to my burning stomach.  In essence I ate a tablespoon of ground spicy chili.  Pain swelled as I watered my burning mouth.  Water doesn't work well but I didn't see a glass of milk or freezing bowl of ice cream so I did my best.  Our entrees were served and I requested Thai hot.  I don't regret this, it was nice and flavorful even though Satan himself was flaming the bonfire in my mouth.   I carried on and enjoyed my Kee Mao with tofu.  The tofu was really good as was the noodles, not choppy and not stuck together, BONUS!  But the portion size seemed more suitable to lunch than dinner with a price tag to match.  If the prices or portions could be adjusted accordingly this may be in contention for one of the best Thai restaurants in the Burgh.  The atmosphere is very nice and modern, so this could also be driving the premium.  Enjoy and be cautious of the killer carousel and a heavy hand!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kee Mao dinner portion
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer rolls
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RFvu1kAvgeH4WTVLSEQblQ.text: Great outdoor porch for yummy Thai food. Parking on the street is free after 6pm. Kind service there. The dumplings were really delicious. They have a spice scale so you can scale the spice to you. They even let me add spice to my pad Thai as I wanted.

hmme5ZLJi2ypOkrTP-a2pQ.text: Love to visit this tiny eatery with its outside patio, when I'm in town. My favorite dish is the crab curry, a delicious blend of crab, kale and coconut milk. Perfect for rainy or cold days when your feeling run down.  As with most items on their menu, You can choose the degree of spiciness your pallet will allow.  Parking in the area is hard to find, which is why i only gave them 4 stars, however they do have delivery, for a hefty fee. Portions are small for the pricing, but the food is delicious.

r_IgkaB7ISvJrdoXPKWl8w.text: This place is absolutely incredible. I thought I had already written my review a long time ago about how great this place is. I have tried every thai place in Pittsburgh, and although is a little bit more on the pricier end. . . it is worth it.   I live close and come here either for lunch or dinner or take-out at least once a week. I never get tired of thai food but that's just me.   Their green curry is absolutely incredible. I have yet to find a green curry that has as much flavor as this one. Their eggplant in the green curry and all the vegetables for that matter are done perfectly. I get the green curry with tofu, although I have had the chicken as well.   If I want to switch it up I get the pad thai or I highly recommend their pad thai special. I think it was that much of a hit that they are making it a permanent item. It is a glass noodle pad thai with chicken and shrimp. I highly recommend that as well. If you are in the mood I also tired their eggplant stir-fry when I wanted to really switch it up because I just could not get enough eggplant and it was very good.   In regards to the appetizer menu, I have officially tired them all and you can not go wrong. My personal preference are the crab ragoon, or spring rolls.   This place is BYOB, but take a short little walk to the wine and spirits right up the street and then come here to enjoy that wine with some wonderful thai food.   Senyai, you will always get a 10/10 in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

f3tVQLu7tr_x-lFf0zX3qQ.text: This is the first time I've actually eaten at Senyai before. I've had take out previously. First it's BYOB but you can always walk to east end shopping center and get a bottle of wine if you forget. We started with the spring rolls as an appetizer. They were okay. I got the crab fried rice and my friend got the crab curry (which I had before). It was delicious. Senyai is one of my favorite places for Thai food in Pittsburgh. We were also fortunate with nice weather to sit on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Fried Rice

dyt1T9_BE2y8knEWEEkuPA.text: Came here on a Thursday night and it was pretty busy! The restaurant is not too big and has a modern vibe inside. We started off with the crab rangoons and summer thai spring rolls. The crab rangoons were perfect! The filling was delicious and I could actually taste crab. The spring rolls were nice and fresh! For dinner, I had the senyai tom yum. The broth was nice and flavorful. A medium heat of 2 was not spicy at all. My friend had the red curry with chicken and enjoyed it as well. My only complaint was that I wish there had been more broth. Overall, an excellent place to grab thai food in the shadyside area. For the amount of food given, prices are on the higher end, but still worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab rangoons with spring tofu rolls
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Senyai Tom yum
Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Senyai Tom yum

ELYeNKJdWK34fOTMCfcjGA.text: Visited Senyai for dinner tonight and was glad I did! It's located in what seems to be an updated house... it's small on the inside but super cute! They have a really nice outdoor patio.   We had the Tom Yum soup and chicken satay to start. The chicken was delicious and done well.   We both had curries for our main: red and pumpkin. I loveeeee pumpkin curry and I must say this might be one of my favorite places to get it in the city. The flavor is great. I really appreciate how they have smaller pieces of squash and chicken so I can get a little with each bite!   Their spice levels are hot! I'm not someone who likes things super spicy.. I typically get a lower number. Our waitress said the curry can get pretty hot at baseline so I went for no added spice and I think it still had a kick!  Oh -- and the service was great!  Only managed a picture of the chicken satay because I was too exited to eat the curry!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

r1XaI6CnGaPGwkWrY-Fm1g.text: This was my first time to Senyai Thai Kitchen and it is for sure my favorite Asian restaurant in the city. With the marvelous modern decor and inviting atmosphere it is a perfect fit for a nice evening. The staff was beyond friendly, I was so impressed by their kindness and humor. They for sure added to the experience! The food was amazing and quick, very impressive for such a busy restaurant. They had a multitude of gluten free options and made certain to avoid cross contamination to keep guests safe. It was a wonderful evening and we will certainly be back again. Very impressive!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Fried Rice (GF)

x6oC8T93fMwobRqKJe4aMQ.text: I had mixed feelings about Senyai Thai.  We called for a reservation and when we arrived were seated prior to the reservation time but the hostess seemed inexperienced, asking if my 7 and 4 year olds needed serve-ware!  once we offered , the food took a while but was extremely delicious!  The photos on the site are extremely deceiving, this place is SMALL but if you can manage to get a seat next to the window it is fun to watch the people walking by!

YoV8JO7puECZJQqD41MrPA.text: incredible new place. phenomenal food and price points and the servers as well as hostesses are delightful. if i could i would visit multiple times a week!

dWkPmaay-4phBFljxhO_vA.text: Delicious Thai. Love the outdoor seating and that it's byob ($5 corkage). The crab curry with kale is fantastic.

9PDr5CYShsZXaoB28_dCpQ.text: Recently, we had a lively family reunion dinner here and Senyai proved the perfect venue. Every dish we ordered -- Pad See Yew, Pad See Mao, summer rolls, crab curry -- all of it was fresh and delicious. The owners could not have been more accommodating and our waiter dealt with the (considerable) eccentricities of our party with patience, grace, and good humor. It's BYOB but never fear. There's a beer store just around the corner and a massive wine store a five-minute walk down the street.

gviTqrR1CthQhP_Yx1DjlA.text: Wow! Absolutely the best Thai food in town! Great service and atmosphere to boot! I will definitely be back! I'm already craving the crab curry and purple lemonade!

uMt1Yl9dRcnwj_-Ac3loPg.text: So happy I found this place. The food was great and the owners were very nice and welcoming. Definitely worth going to. Also, byob was a nice plus. Go, you won't regret it!

jP8AouGAdq_HFTabnFdq8Q.text: Absolutely phenomenal Thai food and great atmosphere. Very friendly staff and timely service. I would recommend making a reservation because the seating is limited. Will definitely be going back!!

T8CjseBCiSB6ucdmrJaKMw.text: My husband and I frequent most of the known Thai restaurants around the city. We rate Senyai amongst the elite. Great ambiance, extremely clean and superb service. Pad Thai and Pad See Ew left nothing to be desired.

u-CYdAYFC3pjmqBCGyu8Jw.text: One of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time!  The food was top notch and the service and atmosphere amazing!   Will return.

uckQNiHaM7g-jh46RHU1Dw.text: I was looking forward to take out lunch during a busy week at work. Called ahead to order.  When I arrived, clearly every college student moving in to Pitt and CMU had their family here. I hope that's the reason for the below par meal. I ordered shrimp green curry with brown rice.  Got charged for brown rice but was given white. Since I was already at my next meeting, had to deal. The shrimp were over cooked and the veggies were sparse. No broccoli as listed on the online menus and mostly cheap red peppers. For $16.50... a crappy deal. Spice level of 3 ( the hottest) was a 6/10.  Green Curry sauce was watered down compared to last time.   And my entree was five overcooked shrimp, five pieces of small eggplant, some green beans and peppers and lots of liquid. I hope it was just the college rush but will return to Banana Leaf or Thai Cottage for lunch at work. I loved it the first time so I hope it was a fluke.

Oaxum1WZf7jrH8A8nzyYUw.text: First time visiting this gem tonight. Decor was modern, nice cozy spot. Entree was great, appetizer extremely salty. I ordered the KRA TONG THONG - which came in a nice shell, giving the meat and vegetable mixture some texture but as I told the lady who walked up at the end, it was unrealistically salty. My girlfriend ordered Prad Prik King which was very good and I ordered the Panang Salmon, which was very rich and creamy. Might return but they needed to be more susceptible when things aren't right, like that appetizer.

Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YarKuS2Mih2KFB6r5xuRKA.text: Food was excellent and the staff was very efficient.  Started with the tom kha soup,  had the shrimp appetizer and finished the pad prik  king with chicken. Brought a chilled bottle of white since it's byob.

VPhRfC_r9OfcwlAWkMuIiA.text: Very nicely renovated place with friendly service and great food. We enjoyed dinner here with orders of the Pad Medmamuang and Pad Thai, both of which were quite delicious, and one order of the sticky rice mango which was fantastic.   Unfortunately I don't have much experience with Thai food so my descriptions are somewhat lacking, but if you're looking for all-around solid and decent grub this place should be able to more than provide.   Again, really enjoyed the dessert! Warm and chewy and sweet and well balanced flavor. Yum.

biEU7qH0dCVCzMMRIwFOzg.text: Service is great.  Dining area is small with only tables. Good portions.  Reasonable prices.

0vGBQXwL_RUzmkl0rfySmA.text: My thai food was perfect. I ordered 'real thai hot' and they didn't disappoint. right on the edge of being 'too hot' i loved every bite. Best thai I've had in pittsburgh so far

hgvbaYLuCZmfEQC0CgeERA.text: Food is pretty good, but overpriced for portion size. It's a better experience to dine in rather than take out. I ordered a couple times through Grub Hub and it was ok, but the spice level wasn't consistent with other times I've eaten there.

JMXfmhWdXuuuyxdH1rDrdg.text: The crab curry is the best choice! Great decoration, really friendly and nice! We had a chicken pad Thai, herb wings and the crab curry! The herb wings is okay, nothing too special, pad Thai is more sweeter than what I had before, but the crab curry is delicious! Recommend ordering the crab curry.

4QeK0sMzQXPhbom46MX5Fg.text: Great atmosphere, service and the Food is AMAZING!!! PAD SI-EW was delicious. The crispy rolls to start were also very good.  I wanted to drink the dipping sauce..lol   Very calm and relaxing and clean atmosphere. It's tucked away in Shaddy side but it's definitely a spot you need to try

hTJlr987RDLze3ol6DcXHQ.text: Am visiting Pittsburgh for a week and this place was within walking distance from my hotel. What a gem of a place. Charming, quiet, impeccably clean, the service is very attentive and helpful and the food is . . . Oh my, the food is amazing! I had two of their specials for dinner - Mango Salad and Penang Curry with Tempura Shrimp. Both were crazy delicious! Just the right amount of spice (mild for the salad and medium for the curry). I'm sure I'll be making another visit here during my stay.

MpZYqMSE_hGnMvJESBY7Mg.text: My new favorite Thai place in Pittsburgh. Great food and super clean, which sometimes do not go hand in hand, but here they do. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Pad Thai with shrimp is my go to Thai meal and this easily tops the other big Thai restaurants everyone raves about (don't worry, it's spicy enough).  The crab rangoon appetizer is also a-must.

NLqQOzW9kYN1hXP24VyDxw.text: Delicious food and awesome atmosphere.  Great service and at 5pm we practically had the place to ourselves.

LVmuxamz_iM7hd27oYaL6Q.text: Quality ingredients, delicious food, good atmosphere, friendly staff. This place looks like you're eating in a modern art gallery, and each table had fresh flowers. It's pretty small but definitely not crowded. I got the shrimp pad Thai, mild spice. The shrimp qwere huge and fresh. The noodles weren't all identically wide which makes them seem more authentic to me. If I went again, I'd get medium spice. I tried one of my friend's crab rangoons, which was made with real (not imitation) crab and came with a sweet and sour type dipping sauce. They were light and crispy, with a savory but not too heavy filling. You definitely get what you pay for, and I had enough pad Thai left over for a whole extra meal.

0NPjN4XyDRu9XSHzUt16rA.text: Attentive service and delicious food. Surprised that it wasn't busier. We walked in with 6 people and they graciously accommodated us. Server had good product knowledge and made great recommendations. Everyone at the table loved what they ordered. The place is super clean with modern decor.

ZR7Z_xT8CvpsSQW8aRJFfQ.text: Excellent Thai. Best I've had in Pittsburgh.   Loved the fresh rolls, chicken satay, Pad Thai, and Mussaman Curry.  Great service. Accommodating to Gluten Free/Celiac.

Vdqq2L2OVz30dr4358oX4Q.text: I went there early Nov 2017 and had a very pleasant experience. They have done a wonderful job of the interior design and decor of the place.  It is bright by feels warm and cozy.  At the same time, the place has lots of windows with great urban view. The service is super friendly and welcoming.  The quality of food is good and I really enjoyed that the portions are not huge.  The best part of  our experience tho was the dessert! I had green tea ice cream with sticky rice and I should say it is probably my favorite dessert in Pittsburgh.  I would definitely go back, even if just for the ice cream.  Highly recommended.

xgVBAqYUsrKzUJ9FezCNDw.text: This place is crazy good. Super fresh! If you ask for hot you get HOT!!! They even bring a plate of extra hot chili sauce in addition. Beautiful interior, great staff. A little small on inside, but adds to charm.

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy fried rice with chicken.

74I4EwOWVDHb7jnYB1qmKQ.text: Got take out from here and it was delicious! Really good spice level and friendly service. Personally my favorite Thai place in Shadyside! Also a cute and aesthetically pleasing location as it's in the bottom floor of a converted house!

g57gFYLHzJpP-bOpfiOGwQ.text: I was really excited to try this since there aren't many Thai options in the area. We went for dinner for two one weeknight evening and were seated immediately. The space is intimate, though a bit loud--the restaurant is mostly hard surfaces, so the noise just sort of bounces around.   The staff were great. Attentive and friendly. Can't ask for much more than that for a casual evening out!   The food was overall quite good. My biggest complaint was that I ordered a dish with the maximum spice level and our waitress acted shocked that anyone would do that. When it arrived, it was extremely mild. I'm wondering if it was a kitchen error. No biggie, though, because it was still tasty.   Overall I would recommend Senyai for a nice little evening out.

8QxxhWsm-F2W7FUfgZQQNQ.text: The decour was very lovely and parking wasn't too difficult to find even on a busy night, but most importantly the food was delicious. We had the Tom Yum soup and the Pad Thai. Both were very good and extra spicy (as requested). Would defiantly recommend Senyai to anyone!

gRCkmWl-bewV5bqnccI2dA.text: Smallest takeout portions in Pittsburgh. Portions are smaller than Noodleheads down the road. 14 plus tax for an appetizer sized portion of noodles. Maybe dine in is different, maybe not. I won't ever find out in the future that's for sure.

ppdm83yBB9i1fWl-U1BHqg.text: This is the best Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh!! The owner cooks the food with such love and it shows in every dish. It was perfection!!

photos.caption: Photo of Senyai Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KA0XWXH3I1EpVa1KHQYmbQ.text: A friend mentioned that she has heard good things about Senyai Thai Kitchen so we checked it out on a recent visit to Shadyside. The three of us ordered the Eggplant with Chicken, Pumpkin Curry with Tofu, Senyai Moo Sup with pork and the special Mango Salad with Shrimp. All four dishes were fantastic. We didn't think it could get any better but when the Custard with Sticky Rice and Taro Custard came out we were blown away. They were incredible. We had ordered a Pumkin with Coconut dessert as well, but sadly they were sold out. I guess we will have to come back :). On top of incredible food, the staff are friendly, professional, and efficient. If we didn't live south of Seattle, WA we would be back often!!

uYXgCcXVVnIVoJYIkW1SnQ.text: I've driven past this place several times while doing my laundry at the laundromat down the road. On one laundry day, having not eating breakfast and it was already mid-afternoon, I was feeling pretty peckish. After dumping my clothes in the dryers, I walked to this restaurant. (FYI, there is no lot parking for the restaurant; there is only street parking). The dining area is very small, having maybe 8-10 tables. The decor was also very nice. I could tell they had recently renovated because everything looked new and spotless. I thought this would be a good place to have an intimate meal with someone...although the tables were pretty close to one another.  There were two waitresses, and I was greeted and seated promptly. As an appetizer, I ordered one of the specials that were written on the outdoor sign - the Thai dumplings - and got the Senyai Pad Kee Mao (spice level 2/3). For my drink, I got my usual water along with the Thai iced tea.  I hadn't known that Thai iced tea comprised of brewed tea, spices, sugar, and condensed milk. When it came out, I was wondering why it looked thick, creamy...and orange. I took a sip of it and... SUGAR BOMB! Ick! I'm not a fan of sugary or creamy drinks, and this was both. Although it was good for cleansing my palate of the spice of my main dish, I couldn't finish it.  The Thai dumplings were pretty good. Good filling to dough ratio. It was a little bland, though, even with the soy sauce dip.  Despite the mediocre beginning, the Pad Kee Mao was very good. Spice level was perfect; the portion was great for lunch; and there was a good balance of each ingredient. Unlike the first two things I got, I did finish this dish.  Overall, they had good service; tasty and filling main dish; and nice, upscale decor. For the first two mediocre items, I deducted a star (and a half), so I'm giving this restaurant 3.5 stars (not 4). Because this was my only visit, I'll probably come back again to check out some of their other items.

gd3N8XtOR2Ozj3A77jPSLA.text: Their pad thai and curry noodles were excellent. Had a very good and unique taste to it. However, I didn't like the environment of the restaurant, as it was basically built inside an ordinary house and the price is way too high to justify, especially when their competitor Noodlehead (which also serves thai food) about two blocks away tastes just as good, has more choices on the menu , and is costs about 3-4 times less than this place. Only reason you should come is if you don't want to wait in line for an hour for noodlehead or you don't like the fact that Noodlehead is cash only, but I'd still recommend going to noodlehead instead.

otJvdbMG0gDMVwIzE5kNUA.text: We have been here three times now, so it was about time that I wrote a review! I have to say that this is one of my new Thai places in Pittsburgh. Here's why:   The first visit, we showed up on a Saturday without a reservation. They let us sit outside on their beautiful patio, with the understanding that we would have to be done by a certain time for a larger party to come in. No problem! The service was always quick and kind.   We ordered the fresh rolls, which come with a delicious peanut sauce. I had the green curry with chicken- their curry sauce is amazing- smooth yet spicy with plenty of veggies and generous amounts of chicken. My husband ordered the crab curry, and pronounced it to be his new favorite dish at a Thai restaurant. It is BYOB, so we enjoyed our wine as the sun sank behind us. Ellsworth is a fairly quiet street, so it was a pleasant place to dine. The owner was even enjoying a meal and glass of wine beside us! He very kindly asked about our meals and our made sure we approved of everything. We absolutely did and went back twice in a month to prove it!   Overall a lovely place, and I look forward to many more delicious meals.

t3ErvJ5B8Z7GVzLsFswY_Q.text: This place is my absolute fav for takeout. Food made to order, hot, delicious and full of flavor. You also get a big portion.

-gPkhmPkFc_KyJV7dR0vXQ.text: Smaller restaurant with great deco and ambience. We went in for lunch and it was nice and bright with the large windows in front. The food was good but a bit pricier than other Thai restaurants in the area. I ordered the crab and kale curry - very tasty but could have had more crab meat and kale for the price. My friend ordered a chicken dish with vegetables. It was tasty and a decent portion size, but not mind blowing. I was a bit disappointed that there were no lunch specials. I ended up paying $24 with tip for my crab curry, which I think is pricey for a lunch meal. Service was decent - there was one waitress who was also the hostess, she wasn't super enthusiastic but got the job done. Otherwise, I would give this place a try. They have some very vegetable focused dishes which I appreciate. Might be a good idea to make a reservation for dinner or on a weekend as the place is small.

NIWftnw7dm_Dj8XjIORKAQ.text: Senyai is a super cute little restaurant in Shadyside that my boyfriend and I decided to try last night when we both had a craving for Thai but didn't want to go to Noodlehead (again). The restaurant itself is beautiful and so clean. They recommend reservations because the restaurant is so small but we were seated very quickly at a table by the window. We ordered the Crab Rangoons which were delicious, I probably wouldn't get them again though because they taste just like every other crab Rangoon I've ever eaten. For dinner I got the Grapow Kai Crop Chef's Special and he got the Pad Medmamuang and both were INCREDIBLE! We both like spicy food so we both picked spicy level 2 on a scale of 0-3. It was the perfect level of spice. The portion sizes are bigger than they seem. I highly recommend Senyai Thai and we'll be back again soon!  PS. It's also BYOB!!! $5 corking fee for wine, $1 for beer.

QZ65L5NFDTj9tVbLUoPmdQ.text: Our group stumbled upon Senyai when we stopped in Pitt for dinner on our way back home to Maryland from Michigan. I love how it's in a house - definitely a different but welcome change since we don't have too many restaurants like that in the DMV area.   The inside was small and cozy and I really liked the interior decor, but they unfortunately didn't have room for the four of us inside at the time. Instead of telling us we had to wait, they gave us the option of sitting outside. The weather was perfect and we've been stuck in a car for 7+ hours, so we took it. We were then left to the most lovely garden area, where the staff promptly set up our table. The lady even spent a few minutes trying to position our table so it wouldn't wobble. Our servers was always attentive and nice, and it made me happy to see that they seemed to enjoy their jobs and take pride in the restaurant. Also, the bathroom is super clean. Excellent ambiance, perfect for a date or just hanging out with a few friends.  In terms of food, the portion sizes was just right. The drinks were perfectly sweet. All entrees we ordered were flavorful, seasoned right, and cooked properly - especially surprised with the calamari. It was nice to eat one and not get rubber. My favorite were the two soups we ordered. My friend got Tom Yum, which was hearty and warmed my cold soul up. And I've always been indifferent with Tom Kha until I had Senyai's..and now I'm afraid I'll never have good Tom Kha ever again. Guess I have to come back here next time I'm in Pitt oh nooooo  In short, it was a stinkin' cute restaurant with awesome food and just as awesome service. Even hours later, my heart is still so warm from seeing the staff smile so much. Can't wait until I come back.

9mJuhV6pUNbBUkehM5BTtg.text: Adorable little Thai place in Shadyside. Now that Thai Place on Walnut is closed, its great to have another option for traditional Thai in the neighborhood! Also, they DO have a small patio on the side if you want to enjoy nice weather. Sorry this isn't a long review but if you're reading this to think about going there, just go!

t3pnJ4YBZSBjdtXeoHDLwA.text: Stopped on a whim, and were glad we did! Flavors were fresh and delicious. Friendly, knowledgable staff enquired about food allergies and also made menu suggestions, upon our request. We were very pleased with appetizers, soup, entre, and dessert. (The homemade ice-cream with sticky rice is the way to go, for dessert.) Highly recommend.

OORd-pHVLq5iJb-HCnuv_w.text: this is a fun, hidden spot in shadyside that offers a modern twist on Asian and Thai food. we ordered the summer rolls, crispy rolls, and enoki mushrooms for appetizers. for our entree we ordered the papaya salad with shrimp and pad pak with tofu. everything was seasoned well and the spice level was just enough.   Everything we had was outstanding and I would recommend this place to others. The staff was friendly and helpful with the menu.

ajk5gm-614YxAqj08G0afQ.text: This is a great space. The decor is modern but it is still cozy. Food was good but some items were pushed and didn't live up to my expectation. They also only do a hot scale of 1-3. We were told that 3 was habanero hot, so we ordered everything at a 2 and it definitely lacked some heat! We started with Tom yum soup with tofu that was delicious. We ordered the summer rolls which I highly recommend. We also ordered the dumplings which we were told were a fan favorite but they never came. And the kale salad with tomatoes, avacado and apple cider vinaigrette was pushed but fell short.  For dinner, we had the panang Chicken and prik king stir fry with veggies. Both were good. Then it was suggested that we order the crab curry and the Mama kee mao. Crab curry was good but it could have used some veggies since it only came with kale. The Mama kee mao came with shrimp and squid, but the squid was a little rubbery. The noodles were ok, but remind you of cup of noodles Raman.   $5 corkage fee for wine and $1 corkage fee for beer.

jz4vbp80U5bDsYfLILi6Jw.text: This place has fantastic noodle dishes. At least as good as noodlehead - maybe better. The veggies are very fresh!

RE-LHYLmG7aavs-PxOZFlw.text: Finally made it back for a second taste.  Sad I waited so long!  Couldn't resist getting the grapow kai krop (still delicious!), but also tried their pad si-ew and green curry this time.  Pad si-ew very nice but not amazing.  Green curry was a grand slam!  Perfectly balanced and light, full of delicious veggies.  The eggplant in particular (an Asian variety--not sure which type) was so tasty I that would be perfectly happy with just a bowl of their rice, eggplant and green curry.  As before, staff were lovely people and very professional.  To call them a neighborhood gem is a disservice.  Well worth a trip to Shadyside from anywhere in Pittsburgh.  Additional note:  Hard to imagine an easier online ordering experience.  For the sake of not coming off as a shill, I won't mention their platform by name, but IT. JUST. WORKS. and I wish most other local restaurants used it.  Doesn't require an app or an account.  Ordered and paid from my phone riding the P1 bus home from work and it couldn't have been simpler.

mSGEkkXfWvY0SyPnaESy9A.text: Some of my favorite curry in the Burgh.  The restaurant itself is nice and clean and intimate.  The take-out is just as delicious as the food served at the restaurant.  This place is great!

5qgraEdKYrNOIUcCro-fYQ.text: Sad I didn't take any pic. Was too hungry. The potion was a bit small ( for me) They got 4 stars because 1. The price is a bit high from other Thai restaurants around town. 2. The menu kinda limited. Me and my husband both ordered lunch noodle dish. They both were so good. The spice was right. If I go back to Pittsburgh, I would definitely go back there again.

d9ogf1Oi2yO3KuPAHGvUsA.text: my friend and I were on our way to another restaurant, saw this and decided to give it a try. Quick good service, cute decor and fresh food. I had the lemongrass salad with grilled tofu, the summer rolls, and my friend and I hadddd to get the crab rangoons. All so delicious, I also got the thai iced green tea. It was a good quick affordable meal. It is also BYOB, always a plus!

xq0rJDEplEAgTqGnOtfLnw.text: Went here because we were looking for a new Thai place. I do have to say that the pad see ew was delicious. We also got the Pad Thai - it was ok, it tasted a bit bland and it was nothing compared to the see ew.   Would try again and get some other items! Service was great and was a very cute establishment.
